instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: ERROR <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A SMC
threads.message:
Hi friends.
I am writing from Chile and I have a problem in an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> computer, logic board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
(sorry for the translation)
Equipment had problems in <CAPACITOR>C9081</CAPACITOR> - <CAPACITOR>C9088</CAPACITOR> were replaced and equipment was turned on again, the problem is that the fans are at full capacity, when performing apple tests it indicates problems in SMC, I attach a screenshot.
Replace battery flex, screen flex, trackpad and continue with the same problem.
If they could guide the fault.

Thanks[ATTACH type="full"]59919[/ATTACH]

threads.title: ERROR <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A SMC
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

There should be a problem with trackpad board/flex.
Just in case, disconnect screen cable and test with external monitor; do this to discard ALS issue.
